snippet: Saudi Arabia revised sharply upward the number of cases of the new MERS virus within its borders and said it had been fatal in more than 40 percent of the cases.
abstract: Saudi Arabia sharply revises upward the number of confirmed infections and deaths from the new MERS virus; after a review of medical records, the country's total number of cases of MERS since the virus was isolated in 2012 is now 688, up from 575; death toll is 282, not 190.
lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia revised sharply upward the number of cases of the new MERS virus within its borders and said it had been fatal in more than 40 percent of the cases.
